summary: Prohibits any person, firm or corporation located in a city with a population of one million or more from selling, offering for sale or giving away of beer or wine coolers after ten o'clock post meridian.

memo:
BILL NUMBER:S2251

TITLE OF BILL:
An act
to amend the alcoholic beverage control law, in relation to
prohibiting the sale of beer or wine coolers at retail after ten
o'clock post meridiem in cities with a population of one million or
more

SUMMARY OF PROVISIONS:
This bill would amend the provisions of the
Alcoholic Beverage Control Law to prohibit the sale of beer after
10:00 p.m. in cities of one million or more.

PURPOSE:
This bill would prohibit stores in cities of
one million or
more from selling beer and wine coolers between the hours of 10:00 p.m.
and 8:00 a.m. The implementation of this legislation will promote
peace and safety in our neighborhoods during the overnight hours.

JUSTIFICATION:
Currently, it is very easy to buy beer at all hours of
the night from the growing number of 24-hour convenience stores
located on many street corners. This contributes to the increasing
number of complaints about disorderly people in our neighborhoods.
New York City already has a ban on drinking alcoholic beverages on
the street. Quite a few individuals currently circumvent this
ordinance by placing the beer bottle/can in a paper bag. My bill will
put some teeth in this ordinance. This overnight period is a time
when neighborhoods need and deserve peace and quiet.

FISCAL IMPLICATIONS:
None.

EFFECTIVE DATE:
This act shall take effect immediately.
